      • getIntenzXmlUrl

        public String getIntenzXmlUrl()

      • setIntenzXmlUrl

        public void setIntenzXmlUrl(String intenzXmlUrl)
        Description copied from interface: IntenzConfigMBean
        Sets the format string of URLs to retrieve IntEnz entries as IntEnzXML. It should have the placeholders {0}, {1}, {2} and {3} for ec1, ec2, ec3 and ec4 respectively.
        Specified by:
        setIntenzXmlUrl in interface IntenzConfigMBean

        Sets the base URL for a concrete EC number in the IntEnz website (the complete URL is built just adding the EC number at the end).
        Specified by:
        setEcBaseUrl in interface IntenzConfigMBean
        Parameters:
        ecBaseUrl - the base URL.

      • readFromFile

        public static IntenzConfig readFromFile()
                                 throws IOException
        Reads the configuration for the IntEnz proxy from a properties file intenz-adapter.properties in the classpath.
        Returns:
        a configuration for the IntEnz proxy with the properties values from the file, or the default ones for those missing.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of problems reading from file.
        Since:
        1.0.6
        See Also:
        Properties' keys.

      • readFromFile

        public static IntenzConfig readFromFile(String filePath)
                                 throws IOException
        Reads the configuration from a file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to a file with the configuration properties. Searched first in the classpath, then if not found in the current working directory.
        Returns:
        a configuration for the IntEnz proxy with the properties values from the file, or the default ones for those missing.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of problems reading from file.
        Since:
        1.0.6
        See Also:
        Properties' keys.

      • readFromInputStream

        protected static IntenzConfig readFromInputStream(InputStream is)
                                           throws IOException
        Reads the configuration from an input stream. The properties' keys are:
        • ep.intenz.ws.timeout: (integer) maximum time (ms) to get a response from the web service.
        • ep.intenz.ws.xml.url: (string) URL template to retrieve IntEnz entries as IntEnzXML from the web service. It should have the placeholders {0}, {1}, {2} and {3} for ec1, ec2, ec3 and ec4 respectively.
        • ep.intenz.ec.url: (string) base URL for EC numbers in the IntEnz website (the complete URL is built just adding the EC number at the end).
        Parameters:
        is - an input stream.
        Returns:
        a configuration for the IntEnz proxy with the properties values from the file, or the default ones for those missing.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of problem reading the properties from file.
        Since:
        1.0.6
